stream_context.summary: Kaze focused on Course 11’s “Power Plant,” showcasing a 10-15 % global FPS boost (via coin sprites), demoing a new star model, and prototyping a weight-based platform system while outlining the level’s full flow and required platform types.

development_findings.summary: A 10-15 % performance gain was achieved by turning coins from billboards into screen-space sprites, raising Bunny Brushworks from ~42 FPS to near-60.
development_findings.quote: We found like a 10-15 % performance improvement. At this stage, that is crazy.

development_findings.summary: Most of Course 11 now runs at a near-constant 60 FPS; Kaze doubts further big gains until F3DX3 is implemented.
development_findings.quote: I don't think we will ever see another performance improvement this big until we implement F3DX3.

development_findings.summary: A textured blue star model replaced the vanilla transparent star to improve visual clarity.
development_findings.quote: I think this is a lot nicer than the transparent star in Vanilla Mario 64.

development_findings.summary: Course 11 design: five connected rooms introducing weight platforms, treadmills, collapsing grates, a slide with timed electric hazards, culminating in a multi-mechanic star challenge.
development_findings.quote: Okay, I'll just explain the whole plan… The first room is there to set the mood… then there’s a slide… last room is gonna have a huge star…

development_findings.summary: Weight platforms act like a scale: standing on one lowers it and raises the other; physics coded with shared velocity, friction tweaks, and ground-pound acceleration.
development_findings.quote: I think Biobak's idea of simply repurposing this whole thing actually works better.

development_findings.summary: Variable definition now uses a macro system that exposes actual RAM layout, helping detect collisions and improving code transparency.
development_findings.quote: Look, this is how we program variables now… This is legitimately just better.

development_findings.summary: Visual direction for Power Plant: gritty pipes, vertex lighting from electrical arcs, optional fog; indoor rooms may allow 30-40 k polys due to culling.
development_findings.quote: I was actually thinking of making it so that everything would be lit by lights around… I think that could be looking very, very good.

development_findings.summary: Treadmill objects will accept per-instance scroll speeds to let players exploit inertia for long jumps.
development_findings.quote: Every elevator should have a separate scrolling speed that we can supply… then you could probably do a jump like this and get really far.

development_findings.summary: Large breakable block pile with a hidden coin is planned to introduce destructible elements in the factory.
development_findings.quote: Okay, huge pile of breakable blocks, there's a coin in it if you dig deep.

development_findings.summary: Upcoming sound overhaul by Yoshi Milkman (e.g., authentic grate metal sounds) influences decision to keep certain assets like the collapsing grate.
development_findings.quote: If we have Yoshi Milkman's sound, we should keep the grate intact… This is actually going to sound like metal.

context_findings.summary: Kaze recently moved into a house in Canada; now streams from a basement setup with CRT, squat rack, and Yoshi cabinet.
context_findings.quote: We just moved into our house… We do live in a house now… This is my basement; Zeina has banished me here.

context_findings.summary: Holds a full-time job, limiting hack development; refuses to promise release dates.
context_findings.quote: I have a full-time job, I can't dedicate that much time to just working on this… It's done when it's done.

context_findings.summary: Maintains an extremely frugal lifestyle and jokes about being ‘enslaved to the bank’.
context_findings.quote: I've always lived like a poor person… We are entirely enslaved to the bank.

context_findings.summary: Neck pain and workouts affected stream length; ended early for health reasons.
context_findings.quote: My neck pain today makes this kind of uncomfortable… I want to rest my neck.

context_findings.summary: Game-design philosophy favors meaningful mechanics over collectible ‘number-go-up’ rewards; critical of frequent balance patches in competitive games.
context_findings.quote: I don't like games that rely on having you find little treats. I want the game that rewards me with finding cool concepts.

biobak.summary: Proposed redirecting soap pickups to outside grills in Block Boss fight, which Kaze adopted.
biobak.quote: I agree with Biobak's idea to make the soap go to the outside grills instead, though.

biobak.summary: Suggested converting dangling platforms into a weight-scale system; became the final mechanic.
biobak.quote: Biobak's idea of simply repurposing this whole thing actually works better.

biobak.summary: Responsible for Power Plant textures; Kaze defers visual choices to him.
biobak.quote: I'll leave the textures to Biobak.

zeina.summary: Not directly involved in stream work but playfully ‘banished’ Kaze to the basement studio.
zeina.quote: Zeina has banished me here. She said I'm not allowed to come up unless it's to grab food.

key_stories.title: Coin Sprite Breakthrough
key_stories.summary: Kaze converted coin billboards into screen-space sprites, unexpectedly unlocking a major frame-rate increase.
key_stories.challenge: Bunny Brushworks was stuck around 42 FPS, and overall performance gains seemed exhausted.
key_stories.process: Re-implemented coins as simple screen-space rectangles, reducing draw-calls and CMD load.
key_stories.outcome: 10-15 % global FPS improvement, many areas now hit 60 FPS with debugger off.
key_stories.key_quote: Instead of having them be billboards, they are now rectangles in screen space… We got CMD down to 22.0.

key_stories.title: The Weight Platform Pivot
key_stories.summary: Course 11 needed a distinctive platform; a chat suggestion turned dangling boards into a physics-based scale.
key_stories.challenge: Initial swinging-platform idea felt redundant with existing mechanics.
key_stories.process: Biobak suggested linking two platforms; Kaze rewrote physics using shared velocity and friction tweaks, allowing player manipulation via ground-pounds.
key_stories.outcome: Mechanic finalized and integrated into level flow as the core gimmick.
key_stories.key_quote: We're going with that idea, yes. I like that.

key_stories.title: Release-Date Pushback
key_stories.summary: Viewers kept asking for launch timing; Kaze addressed expectations frankly.
key_stories.challenge: Community pressure for a release date despite limited dev time.
key_stories.process: Explained full-time job and refusal to crunch; reiterated ‘done when it's done’.
key_stories.outcome: No date promised; sets tone for future communications.
key_stories.key_quote: Guys, this releases when it gets done. Like, literally just leave me alone.
